zendesk.suas

Class LoggerMiddleware

  • java.lang.Object
    • zendesk.suas.LoggerMiddleware
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Middleware

    public class LoggerMiddleware
extends java.lang.Object
implements Middleware
    Middleware for logging State changes.

    Create an instance using the default constructor: 

     Middleware logger = new LoggerMiddleware();
    or using the builder for more configuration options: 
     Middleware logger = new LoggerMiddleware.Builder()
      .withTitleFormatter(...)
      .withSerialization(...)
      ...
      .build()
    Make sure the the logger is the last middleware in the list: 
     Middleware logger = new LoggerMiddleware()

 Store store = Suas.createStore(...)
       .widthMiddleware(middleware1, middleware2, ... middlewareN, logger)
       .builder().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LoggerMiddleware.Builder
      Fluent API for configuring a logger
      static interface  LoggerMiddleware.LogAppender
      Callback for printing logs
      static interface  LoggerMiddleware.Predicate
      Callback that decides if the logger should print or not.
      static class  LoggerMiddleware.Serialization
      Serialization Type
      static interface  LoggerMiddleware.TitleFormatter
      Callback for creating the title line
      static interface  LoggerMiddleware.Transformer<E>
      Callback that allows converting an object of type <E> to a String before printing

    • Method Detail

      • onAction

        public void onAction(@NonNull
                     Action<?> action,
                     @NonNull
                     GetState state,
                     @NonNull
                     Dispatcher dispatcher,
                     @NonNull
                     Continuation continuation)
        Description copied from interface: Middleware
        Called before an Action gets passed to the Reducers.

        Examples: Log state changes: 

         void onAction(...) {
    State oldState = state.getState();
    continuation.next(action);
    State newState = state.getState();

    System.out.println(stateDiff(oldState, newState));
 }
        Consume an Action and dispatch it on a background thread: 
         void onAction(...) {
    if(action.getData() instanceof AsyncAction) {
        // consume action
        backgroundTask.start(action.getData, dispatcher);
    } else {
        continuation.next(action);
    }
 }
        Specified by:
        onAction in interface Middleware
        Parameters:
        action - a dispatched action
        state - access to the current state
        dispatcher - access to the dispatcher for dispatching a new action
        continuation - callback for passing the action to the next middleware
